meanings.definition: The jointed or movable part of a finger or toe.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally closed the door on my dactylus.
meanings.sent2: She painted her dactylus nails a bright red color.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to catch the moving dactylus under the door.
meanings.sent4: His dactylus pointed accusingly at the broken vase.
meanings.sent5: The ring slipped off her dactylus and fell into the sink.

meanings.definition: A metrical foot consisting of one stressed syllable followed by two unstressed syllables.
meanings.sent1: In poetry class, we learned about the dactylus rhythm.
meanings.sent2: The song had a catchy dactylus that made it easy to dance to.
meanings.sent3: The dactylus of the music made everyone tap their feet.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had a dactylus-like quality that was infectious.
meanings.sent5: The dactylus of the drumbeat echoed through the room.
